CatDescriptText: Mrs. Johnson and Paul Goodwin, salesman, Fox Chapel, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 4, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think there is immediate danger of a third world war?  Why? If so, whom do you think our allies will be?"  Mrs. Johnson's answer was not published. Mr. Goodwin's answer reads: "I would say that at this point there is not an immediate danger of war, but another incident similar to the one we just had probably will trigger a war.  With another U2 incident, I don't think that Russia will stand still, because it will hurt her prestige with the satellite countries."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Mrs. Johnson wearing snowflake patterned jumper, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Paul Goodwin wearing tweed suit jacket standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
